intro: Hepatica triloba subf. hypopurpurea, commonly known as the pale purple hepatica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, early spring blooms. The flowers are typically pale purple or white, with five to seven sepals that resemble petals. This plant thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in rich, acidic soils. It plays an important role in early pollination by attracting bees and other early-season pollinators.
